definition: to have boundless prospects
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
way/route/road
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word
to measure

sentences.english: At any rate the theoretical prospect seems no longer precluded.
sentences.chinese: 至少从理论上来说，这项事业似乎前途无量。

sentences.english: Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measures.
sentences.chinese: 我们最恐惧的是我们前途无量。

sentences.english: That young ball player will bear watching.
sentences.chinese: 那位青年球员前途无量。

sentences.english: We should keep an eye on this kid. Definitely a bright future.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该留意一下科沃尔这个年轻人，前途无量啊。

sentences.english: May I wish you every success for the future?
sentences.chinese: 祝你前途无量马到成功。

definition: young and promising
to have a future full of promise
a giant among men (idiom)
the young will be redoubtable in the years to come (idiom)/the younger generations will surpass us in time
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
prospects/future outlook/journey
rising straight up in a clear sky (idiom); rapid promotion to a high post/meteoric career
to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
to accomplish much/to have good prospects/to have a promising future
outstanding talent (idiom); incomparable artistic merit
to stand a good chance/to have great hopes/to be promising
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
to lead by the hand/to guide/to support
brimming over with talent (esp. literary)/brilliant
future (career etc) prospects
to regard sth as valuable/to think highly of (a younger person, a subordinate etc)
